sourcesContent:
<template>
  <a-form
    :model="formModel"
    :layout="'horizontal'"
    :rules="rules"
    ref="formRef"
  >
    <a-form-item label="Username" name="username" :rules="rules.username">
      <a-input v-model="formModel.username" />
    </a-form-item>

    <a-form-item label="Password" name="password" :rules="rules.password">
      <a-input-password v-model="formModel.password" />
    </a-form-item>

    <a-form-item
      label="Confirm Password"
      name="confirmPassword"
      :rules="rules.confirmPassword"
    >
      <a-input-password v-model="formModel.confirmPassword" />
    </a-form-item>

    <a-form-item
      label="Employee Key"
      name="employeeKey"
      :rules="rules.employeeKey"
    >
      <a-input v-model="formModel.employeeKey" />
    </a-form-item>

    <a-form-item
      label="Phone Number"
      name="phoneNumber"
      :rules="rules.phoneNumber"
    >
      <a-input v-model="formModel.phoneNumber" />
    </a-form-item>

    <a-form-item>
      <a-button type="primary" @click="handleSubmit">Register</a-button>
    </a-form-item>
  </a-form>
</template>

<script>
import { ref } from "vue";

export default {
  setup() {
    const formModel = ref({
      username: "",
      password: "",
      confirmPassword: "",
      employeeKey: "",
      phoneNumber: "",
    });

    const formRef = ref(null);

    const rules = {
      username: [{ required: true, message: "Please input your username!" }],
      password: [{ required: true, message: "Please input your password!" }],
      confirmPassword: [
        { required: true, message: "Please confirm your password!" },
        {
          validator: (rule, value, callback) => {
            if (value !== formModel.value.password) {
              callback(new Error("The two passwords do not match!"));
            } else {
              callback();
            }
          },
          trigger: "blur",
        },
      ],
      employeeKey: [
        { required: true, message: "Please input your employee key!" },
      ],
      phoneNumber: [
        { required: true, message: "Please input your phone number!" },
        { pattern: /^1[3-9]\d{9}$/, message: "Phone number is not valid!" },
      ],
    };

    const handleSubmit = () => {
      formRef.value
        .validate()
        .then(() => {
          console.log("Form validated", formModel.value);
          // Handle registration logic here
        })
        .catch((error) => {
          console.error("Form validation failed", error);
        });
    };

    return {
      formModel,
      formRef,
      rules,
      handleSubmit,
    };
  },
};
</script>

<style scoped>
/* Add any custom styles here */
</style>
